name: ACTIONBAR_PAGE_CHANGED
description: Fired when the actionbar page changes, typically when you press the pageup or pagedown button.

args.description: the mouse button used to click the button. Known values: "LeftButton", "RightButton"

name: ACTIONBAR_SHOWGRID
description: Fired when the actionbar numbers appear, typically when you drag a spell to the actionbar.

args.description: the mouse button used to drag the spell. Known values: "LeftButton", "RightButton"

name: ACTIONBAR_SLOT_CHANGED
description: Fired when any actionbar slot's contents change.

args.description: the number of the slot that changed

name: ACTIONBAR_UPDATE_COOLDOWN
description: Fired when the cooldown for an actionbar or inventory slot starts or stops. Also fires when you log into a new area.  * if the cooldown is stopping or you are logging into a new zone, this is nil

args.description: if the cooldown is starting, the mouse button used to click the button. Known values: "leftButton"

name: ACTIONBAR_UPDATE_STATE
description: Fired when the state of anything on the actionbar changes. This includes cooldown and disabling.  * can also be nil

args.description: the mouse button used to click the button. Known values: "LeftButton", "RightButton"

name: ACTIONBAR_UPDATE_USABLE
description: Fired when something in the actionbar or your inventory becomes usable again (after eating or drinking a potion, for example).

name: ADDON_LOADED
description: This event fires whenever an AddOn is loaded (fires once for each AddOn loaded if multiple AddOns are being loaded), whether that is during the inital Loading Phase or when an AddOn is loaded using the LoadAddOn("addonname") or UIParentLoadAddon("addonname") function.  This event always fires after that Saved Variables of the AddOn that just finished loading have been loaded from the disk.

args.description: name of the AddOn that was just loaded

name: AUTOEQUIP_BIND_CONFIRM
description: Fired when the game attempts to autobind bind-on-equip items.

name: AUTOFOLLOW_BEGIN
description: Fired when you begin automatically following an ally.

args.description: The unit you are following.  Not necessarily your target (in case of right-clicking a group member's portrait or using the "/follow" command).

name: AUTOFOLLOW_END
description: Fired when the player ceases following an ally

name: BAG_CLOSED
description: Fired when a bag is closed

name: BAG_OPEN
description: Fired when a bag (NOTE: This is NOT fired for player containers, it's for those bag-like objects that you can remove items from but not put items into) is opened.

name: BAG_UPDATE
description: Fired when a bags inventory changes

name: BAG_UPDATE_COOLDOWN
description: Fired when a cooldown update call is sent to a bag

name: BANKFRAME_CLOSED
description: Fired when the bank window is closed

name: BANKFRAME_OPENED
description: Fired when the bank frame is opened

name: BIND_ENCHANT
description: Fired when Enchanting an unbound item.

name: CHARACTER_POINTS_CHANGED
description: Fired when the player's character points are changed.

name: CHAT_MSG
description: Fired when the client recieves a chat message.

name: CHAT_MSG_AFK
description: Fired when the client receives an AFK auto-response

name: CHAT_MSG_BG_SYSTEM_ALLIANCE
description: Fired for alliance specific events in the battleground such as assaulting a graveyard.

args.description: Battleground Message  (eg. "The Alliance has taken the Blacksmith!")

name: CHAT_MSG_BG_SYSTEM_HORDE
description: Fired for horde specific events in the battleground such as assaulting a graveyard.

args.description: Battleground Message  (eg. "The Horde has taken the Blacksmith!")

name: CHAT_MSG_BG_SYSTEM_NEUTRAL
description: Fired for non faction specific events in the battlegrounds such as the battle start announcement.

name: CHAT_MSG_CHANNEL
description: Fired when the client recieves a channel message.  * zone is always current zone even if not the same as the channel name * second player name when two users are passed for a CHANNEL_NOTICE_USER (E.G. x kicked y) * not used for custom channels or if you joined an Out-Of-Zone channel ex: "General - Stormwind City" * zone is always current zone even if not the same as the channel name

args.description: channel name with number ex: "5. General - Stormwind City"
zone ID used for genaric system channels (General, Trade, LookingForGroup and LocalDefense)

name: CHAT_MSG_CHANNEL_JOIN
description: Fired when someone joins a chat channel you are in

args.description: Name of the player that joined
Number and name of the channel (e.g. "5. MyOwnChannel")

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_CREATURE_VS_CREATURE_HITS
description: Fired when a creature hits another creature

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_CREATURE_VS_CREATURE_MISSES
description: Fired when a creature misses another creature

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_CREATURE_VS_PARTY_HITS
description: Fired when a creature hits a party member

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_CREATURE_VS_PARTY_MISSES
description: Fired when a creature misses a party memeber

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_CREATURE_VS_SELF_HITS
description: Fired when a creature hits you

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_CREATURE_VS_SELF_MISSES
description: Fired when a creature misses you

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_HONOR_GAIN
description: Fired when you successfully kill a worthy pvp opponent

args.description: chat message (format: "%s dies, honorable kill Rank: %s (Estimated Honor Points: %d)")

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_HOSTILE_DEATH
description: Fired when any hostile (NPC or player) dies near you.

args.description: complete text from combat-log (e.g. "Snowshoe Rabbit dies.")

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_MISC_INFO
description: Fired when you gain reputation from killing a creature or finishing a quest.

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_SELF_HITS
description: Fired when a you hit a creature. Also called when you hurt yourself by falling, drowning or burning on a campfire.

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_SELF_MISSES
description: Fired when a you miss a creature

name: CHAT_MSG_COMBAT_XP_GAIN
description: Fired when you gain xp from killing a creature or finishing a quest. Does not fire if you gain no xp from killing a creature.

name: CHAT_MSG_DND
description: Fired when the client receives a Do-Not-Disturb auto-response

name: CHAT_MSG_EMOTE
description: Fired on sending or revicing a custom emote (one used by /e, /emote or a send chat message command with the emote flag)

args.description: Name of the player who sent the message.

name: CHAT_MSG_GUILD
description: Fired when a message is sent or received in the Guild channel.

args.description: Name of the player who sent the message.

Language the message was spoken in. (See [CHAT_MSG_SAY](http://www.wowwiki.com/Events_C_%28Cancel%2C_Character%2C_Chat%2C_Cinematic%2C_Clear%2C_Close%2C_Confirm%2C_Corpse%2C_Craft%2C_Current%2C_Cursor%2C_CVar%29#CHAT_MSG_SAY) for example code)

name: CHAT_MSG_LOOT
description: Fired when a unit loots an item.

name: CHAT_MSG_OFFICER
description: Fired when a message is sent or received in the Guild Officer channel.

args.description: Name of the player who sent the message.

Language the message was spoken in.(See [CHAT_MSG_SAY](http://www.wowwiki.com/Events_C_%28Cancel%2C_Character%2C_Chat%2C_Cinematic%2C_Clear%2C_Close%2C_Confirm%2C_Corpse%2C_Craft%2C_Current%2C_Cursor%2C_CVar%29#CHAT_MSG_SAY) for example code)

name: CHAT_MSG_PARTY
description: Fired when a message is sent or received in the Party channel.

args.description: Name of the player who sent the message.

Language the message was spoken in.(See [CHAT_MSG_SAY](http://www.wowwiki.com/Events_C_%28Cancel%2C_Character%2C_Chat%2C_Cinematic%2C_Clear%2C_Close%2C_Confirm%2C_Corpse%2C_Craft%2C_Current%2C_Cursor%2C_CVar%29#CHAT_MSG_SAY) for example code)

name: CHAT_MSG_RAID
description: Fires when a player speaks in /raid chat.

name: CHAT_MSG_RAID_WARNING
description: Fired when a warning message is sent or received from the raid leader.

name: CHAT_MSG_SAY
description: Fired when a message is sent or received in the Say channel.   _Example:_Place `this:RegisterEvent("CHAT_MSG_SAY");` in the `<OnLoad>`/`<OnLoad>` section of your MyMod.xml file. Then, have an `if (event == "CHAT_MSG_SAY") then MyMod_Say(event, arg1, arg2, arg3); end` line, or something like it, in the `<OnEvent>`/`</OnEvent>` section of your MyMod.xml file. Then, have a function like the following in your MyMod.lua file: ``` function MyMod_Say(event, arg1, arg2, arg3) PrevMsg = arg1; PrevPlyr = arg2; PrevLang = arg3; end ``` This would store the previous message, player who said it, and language it was said in into some variables.

name: CHAT_MSG_SKILL
description: Fired when some chat messages about skills are displayed.   * `ERR_SKILL_GAINED_S` (eg. "You have gained the Blacksmithing skill.") * `ERR_SKILL_UP_SI` (eg. "Your skill in Cooking has increased to 221.")

args.description: The content of the chat message. **arg1** formats are found in Blizzard's `GlobalStrings.lua`.  Some possibilities:

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_AURA_GONE_OTHER
description: Fired whenever a buff or debuff wears off of a mob, npc, or another player. Examples: Thorns, Trueshot Aura, Recently Bandaged. arg1 is the full chat text, i.e. "Thorns fades from Someguy."

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_AURA_GONE_SELF
description: Fired whenever a buff or debuff wears off - examples, Prowl, Mark of the Wild, Cat Form, or Disarm.  arg1 is the full chat text, i.e. "Prowl fades from you."

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_CREATURE_VS_CREATURE_BUFF
description: Fired when a mob begins casting a beneficial spell and again when the casting is completed. arg1 is the full combat chat text. Examples: Mob begins to cast Heal. Mob's Heal heals Mob for 20.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_CREATURE_VS_CREATURE_DAMAGE
description: Fired when a creature casts a damage spell on a raid member who is not in your group. Also triggered when a pet is damaged by a creature's spell. Ex: Ragnaros' Wrath of Ragnaros hits PlayerName for 1000.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_CREATURE_VS_SELF_DAMAGE
description: Fired when a mob completes casting a harmful spell on you. (The message for the mob beginning to cast is given by CHAT_MSG_SPELL_CREATURE_VS_CREATURE_DAMAGE.) arg1 is the full combat chat text and includes results of the cast or skill use (e.g. hit, resist, dodge). Examples: Mob's Poison hits you for 10. Mob's  Melee Special was dodged. Mob's Nuke was resisted.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_DAMAGESHIELDS_ON_SELF
description: Fired when a buff (or possibly item) damages an opponent in response to an action... IE Thorns.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_FAILED_LOCALPLAYER
description: Fired when you fail to successfully cast a spell, for one of several reasons. arg1 is the full combat chat text and includes the reason. Examples: You fail to cast Heal: Interrupted. You fail to perform Bear Form: Not enough mana.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_FRIENDLYPLAYER_BUFF
description: Fired when a non-hostile player begins casting a spell or using a skill. arg1 is the full combat chat text. Some examples: Someguy casts Reinforced Armor +40 on Someguys's Pants. Someguy begins to cast Elixir of Whatever. Someguy begins to cast Conjure Food. Someguy begins to cast Summon Felsteed.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_PERIODIC_CREATURE_BUFFS
description: Fired when a mob gains an "insta-cast" beneficial effect. arg1 is the full combat chat text. Examples: Mob gains Defensive Stance. Mob gains Rushing Charge. Mob gains Demon Skin.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_PERIODIC_CREATURE_DAMAGE
description: example: "Highland Strider suffers 8 Fire damage from your Fireball."

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_PERIODIC_FRIENDLYPLAYER_BUFFS
description: Fired when a non-hostile player gains a "buff" effect. arg1 is the full combat chat text. Some examples: Someguy gains Arcane Intellect. Someguy gains Aspect of the Pack. Someguy gains Felsteed.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_PERIODIC_HOSTILEPLAYER_BUFFS
description: For some weird reason, this event is fired when someone heals yourself or another player, eg *"Priest's Flash Heal critically heals you for 2342"* Haven't tested any other conditions as of yet.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_PERIODIC_SELF_BUFFS
description: Fired when a buff is cast on self. (Unknown if external buff triggers this). Arg 1 is "You gain $foo" Where $foo is the name of the buff. *Also called for each "tick" of recurring effects, such as "heal-over-time" spells. Example: You gain 10 health from Rejuvenation. --Syllani*

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_PERIODIC_SELF_DAMAGE
description: Fired (possibly among other times) when you are debuffed - so Disarm, Silenced, etc.  I know the name doesn't match, but if you want to verify, enable printing this in your chat log.  Get into combat and get debuffed.  After combat, scroll back up, and while the debuff message is onscreen, change the chat color of this message, and you will see it change...  Very strange.  I assume this is named after poisons or diseases, but I haven't actually tested if those trigger this.  See CHAT_MSG_SPELL_AURA_GONE_SELF if you want to know when it wears off (both buffs and debuffs).  This is accurate as of US Release 1.2.4 (4222), tested by hacking Scrolling Combat Text.  arg1 is the full text of the debuff message, e.g. "You are Disarmed." This is also fired during the Gnomish Death Ray's channel. *This is indeed triggered by poison / disease. arg1 messages in the form of: "You suffer 3 damage from Scorpid's Poison" or "You are afflicted by Something" come from this event. --Syllani*

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_SELF_BUFF
description: Fired when you cast a beneficial spell. arg1 is the full combat chat text. Examples: Your Heal heals you for 50. Your Regrowth critically heals Someguy for 100.

name: CHAT_MSG_SPELL_SELF_DAMAGE
description: Fired whenever you cast a damage-dealing spell. arg1 holds the exact same string that is posted to the Battle Log (Something like "SpellXY hits EnemyPQ with 42 damage")

name: CHAT_MSG_SYSTEM
description: Fired when a system chat message (they are displayed in yellow) is received.  * `ERR_LEARN_RECIPE_S` (eg. "You have learned how to create a new item: Bristle Whisker Catfish.") * `MARKED_AFK_MESSAGE` (eg. "You are now AFK: Away from Keyboard")

args.description: The content of the chat message. **arg1** formats are found in Blizzard's `GlobalStrings.lua`.  Some possibilities:

name: CHAT_MSG_TEXT_EMOTE
description: Fired for emotes with an emote token. /dance, /healme, etc

name: CHAT_MSG_WHISPER
description: Fired when a whisper is received from another player.arg1 = text sent.arg2 = player who sent whisper.arg6 = status of player (AFK or DND)Note: the rest of the arguments seem to be nil, although arg7 and arg8 are 0. I have yet to discover their meaning.

name: CHAT_MSG_WHISPER_INFORM
description: Fired when a whisper is sent to another player.Arg1 = text sent.Arg2 = player whisper sent to.Arg3 = Language message was sent in (even though the other player, if of the same faction, can read the message regardless, and doesn't even see what language you sent it in).

name: CHAT_MSG_YELL
description: Fired when a message is sent or received in the Yell channel.

args.description: Name of the player who sent the message.

Language the message was spoken in. (See [CHAT_MSG_SAY](http://www.wowwiki.com/Events_C_%28Cancel%2C_Character%2C_Chat%2C_Cinematic%2C_Clear%2C_Close%2C_Confirm%2C_Corpse%2C_Craft%2C_Current%2C_Cursor%2C_CVar%29#CHAT_MSG_SAY) for example code)

name: CLEAR_TOOLTIP
description: Fired when the tooltip needs to be wiped

name: CLOSE_TABARD_FRAME
description: Fired when the guild dress frame is closed

name: CLOSE_WORLD_MAP
description: Fired when the world map is hidden.

name: CONFIRM_XP_LOSS
description: loss in exchange for his body back.

name: CORPSE_IN_RANGE
description: Fired when the player is in range of his body.

name: CORPSE_OUT_OF_RANGE
description: Fired when the player is out of range of his body.

name: CRAFT_CLOSE
description: Fired when a crafting skill window closes. Crafting skills are Enchanting, <craftSkill2>,...

args.description: The mouse button used to close the window.

name: CRAFT_SHOW
description: Fired when a crafting skill window opens. Crafting skills are Enchanting, <craftSkill2>,...

args.description: The mouse button used to open the window.

name: CRAFT_UPDATE
description: Fired when a crafting event is updating.

name: CURRENT_SPELL_CAST_CHANGED
description: Fired when the spell being cast is changed.

name: CURSOR_UPDATE
description: Fired when the player single-clicks terrain. This excludes doodads, NPCs and other PCs.

name: CVAR_UPDATE
description: Fired when a CVar is changed

name: DELETE_ITEM_CONFIRM
description: Fired when the player attempts to destroy an item.

name: DUEL_FINISHED
description: Fired when a duel is finished.

name: DUEL_INBOUNDS
description: Fired when the player is still in the bounds of the duel.

name: DUEL_OUTOFBOUNDS
description: Fired when the player leaves the bounds of the duel

name: DUEL_REQUESTED
description: Fired when the player is challenged to a duel

name: EQUIP_BIND_CONFIRM
description: Fired when the player attempts to equip bind on equip loot.

name: EXECUTE_CHAT_LINE
description: Fired when the chat line needs to be processed.

name: FRIENDLIST_UPDATE
description: Fired when... 1. You log in 2. Open the friends window (twice) 3. Switch from the ignore list to the friend's list 4. Switch from the guild, raid, or who tab back to the friends tab (twice) 5. Add a friend 6. Remove a friend 7. Friend comes online 8. Friend goes offline

name: GOSSIP_CLOSED
description: Fired when you close the talk window for an npc (Seems to be called twice)

args.description: The mouse button used to close the window (nil if closed when you go out of range)

name: GOSSIP_SHOW
description: Fired when you talk to an npc (Quest dialogue boxes and Vending boxes do not call this event)

name: GUILD_INVITE_CANCEL
description: Fired when the guild invitation is declined.

name: GUILD_INVITE_REQUEST
description: Fired when you are invited to join a guild.

name: GUILD_ROSTER_UPDATE
description: Fired when the client's guild info cache has been updated after a call to [GuildRoster()](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_GuildRoster).

name: IGNORELIST_UPDATE
description: Fired when a player is added or removed from the ignore list.  Event is called twice.  Not certain why it is called twice.

name: INSTANCE_BOOT_START
description: Fired when the countdown to boot a player from an instance starts.

name: INSTANCE_BOOT_STOP
description: Fired when the countdown to boot a player from an instance stops.

name: ITEM_PUSH
description: Fired when an item is pushed onto the "inventory-stack". For instance when you manufacture something with your trade skills or picks something up. arg1 - the stack size (i.e. how many copies of this item fit in a single inventory slot) arg2 - the path to the item's icon

name: ITEM_TEXT_BEGIN
description: Fired when an items text begins displaying

name: ITEM_TEXT_CLOSED
description: Fired when the items text has completed its viewing and is done.

name: ITEM_TEXT_READY
description: Fired when the item's text can continue and is ready to be scrolled.

name: ITEM_TEXT_TRANSLATION
description: Fired when an item is in the process of being translated.

name: LEARNED_SPELL_IN_TAB
description: Fired when a new spell/ability is added to the spellbook. e.g. When training a new or a higher level spell/ability. arg1 - Number of the tab which the spell/ability is added to

name: LOOT_BIND_CONFIRM
description: Fired when the player attempts to take 'bind-on-pickup' loot

name: LOOT_CLOSED
description: Fired when a player ceases looting a corpse.

name: LOOT_OPENED
description: Fired when a corpse is looted

name: LOOT_SLOT_CLEARED
description: Fired when loot is removed from a corpse. arg1 - Slot number

name: MAIL_INBOX_UPDATE
description: Fired when the opened inbox changes in any way. For example when the inbox list is loaded after the frame has been opened, or when a mail item changes from new to read.

name: MAIL_SEND_INFO_UPDATE
description: Fired when an item is dragged to or from the Send Item box in an outgoing mail message.

name: MAIL_SEND_SUCCESS
description: Fired when a mail has been successfully sent to the mailbox of the recipient, it is also called when the mailbox is opened for some reason ... bug?

name: MAIL_SHOW
description: Fired when the mailbox is opened.

name: MEMORY_EXHAUSTED
description: Fired when all memory allocated to the UI is exhausted.

name: MEMORY_RECOVERED
description: Fired when WoW recovers from an out of memory error.

name: MERCHANT_CLOSED
description: Fired when a merchant frame closes.

name: MERCHANT_SHOW
description: Fired when the merchant frame is shown.

name: MERCHANT_UPDATE
description: Fired when a merchant updates

name: MINIMAP_PING
description: Fired when the minimap is pinged.

args.description: UnitId of the one that created the ping (ie "player" or any of the group members)

name: MINIMAP_UPDATE_ZOOM
description: Fired when the minimap scaling factor is changed.  This happens, generally, whenever the player moves indoors from outside, or vice versa.  There are no arguments to this event.  To test the player's location, compare the `minimapZoom` and `minimapInsideZoom` CVars with the current minimap zoom level (see [GetZoom](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_Minimap_GetZoom)). This event does not relate to the **+** and **-** minimap zoom buttons.

name: MIRROR_TIMER_PAUSE
description: Fired when the mirror timer is paused.

name: MIRROR_TIMER_START
description: Fired when some sort of timer starts.

name: MIRROR_TIMER_STOP
description: Fired when a mirror timer is stopped.

name: OPEN_TABARD_FRAME
description: Fired when the guild dress frame is opened.

name: PARTY_INVITE_CANCEL
description: Fired when you decline a party invite.

name: PARTY_INVITE_REQUEST
description: Fired when a player invite you to party.

name: PARTY_LEADER_CHANGED
description: Fired when the player's leadership changed. Referred to as *buggy*.

name: PARTY_LOOT_METHOD_CHANGED
description: Fired when the party's loot method changes

name: PARTY_MEMBERS_CHANGED
description: Fired when the player's party changes. As of 1.8.3 this event also fires when players are moved around in a Raid and when a player leaves the raid. This holds true even if the changes do not affect your party within the raid. This event is called twice when the event `PARTY_LOOT_METHOD_CHANGED` is called. This event is generated whenever someone rejects an invite and your in a group, also generated obviously when someone joins or leaves the group.  Also, if for instance you have 3 people in your group and you invite a 4th, it will generate 4 events.  If you call `GetNumPartyMembers()` it will return 0, 1, 2, and 3. First event returing zero, 2nd event returning 1, etc etc.

name: PARTY_MEMBER_DISABLE
description: Fired when a specific party member is offline or dead

name: PARTY_MEMBER_ENABLE
description: Fired when a specific party member is still connected

name: PET_ATTACK_START
description: Fired when the player's pet begins attacking.

name: PET_ATTACK_STOP
description: Fired when the player's pet ceases attack

name: PET_BAR_HIDEGRID
description: Fired when the pet bar should be hidden. (dismiss/die)

name: PET_BAR_SHOWGRID
description: Fired when the Pet bar is supposed to be displayed

name: PET_BAR_UPDATE
description: Fired when the pet bar is updates.

name: PET_BAR_UPDATE_COOLDOWN
description: Fired when a pet spell cooldown starts. It is not called when cooldown ends.

name: PLAYERBANKBAGSLOTS_CHANGED
description: Fired when the One of the six bag slots bank changes. Does **not** fire when an item is added to or removed from a bank bag, only when a bag is added or removed from the bag slots.

name: PLAYERBANKSLOTS_CHANGED
description: Fired when the One of the slots in the pleyer's 24 bank slots has changed. Does **not** fire when an item is added to or removed from a bank bag.

name: PLAYER_ALIVE
description: Fired when the player: 1. Releases from death to a graveyard. 2. Feigns Death with the hunter skill. 3. Lands from a jump or fall. 4. Accepts a resurrect before releasing their spirit.  This is *not* called when the player is alive after being a ghost. `PLAYER_UNGHOST` is triggered in that case.

name: PLAYER_AURAS_CHANGED
description: Called when a buff or debuff is either applied to a unit or is removed from the player.  (Further details to follow, study needed).

args.description: This event is also called when a Druid changes Form (or changes Prowl state when in Cat Form).  **arg1** - **arg9** are all nil in these cases. These args are probably nil for other classes as well. Also, this event can be called multiple times per Form change.

name: PLAYER_CAMPING
description: Fired when the player is camping

name: PLAYER_COMBO_POINTS
description: arg1 is always 'player' not the number of combo points you have. Use the function GetComboPoints(); to get the exact number of combo points you have.

name: PLAYER_CONTROL_GAINED
description: Fires after the PLAYER_CONTROL_LOST event, when control has been restored to the player.

name: PLAYER_CONTROL_LOST
description: Fires whenever the player is unable to control the character.  Examples are when afflicted by fear or when using a taxi.

name: PLAYER_DEAD
description: Fired when the player has died.

name: PLAYER_ENTERING_WORLD
description: Fired when the player enters the world, enters/leaves an instance, or respawns at a graveyard.  Also fires any other time the player sees a loading screen. To check if the player is entering an instance, check [GetPlayerMapPosition](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_GetPlayerMapPosition) to see if both X and Y are zero.

name: PLAYER_ENTER_COMBAT
description: Fired when a player engages auto-attack. Note that firing a gun or a spell, or getting aggro, does NOT trigger this event.  From a post by Dhrago on the WoW forums: `PLAYER_ENTER_COMBAT` and `PLAYER_LEAVE_COMBAT` are for *MELEE* combat only. They fire when you initiate autoattack and when you turn it off. However, any spell or ability that does not turn on autoattack does not trigger it. Nor does it trigger when you get aggro. You probably want [PLAYER_REGEN_ENABLED](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/Events_A-Z_(full_list)?direction=prev&oldid=161492#PLAYER_REGEN_ENABLED) (happens when you lose aggro).

name: PLAYER_FLAGS_CHANGED
description: This event fires when a Unit's flags change (eg: due to /afk, /dnd, etc.)

args.description: The [UnitId](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) affected, eg: "player"

WoW appears to condense simultaneous flag changes into a single event. If you are currently AFK and not(DND) but you type /dnd you'll see two Chat Log messages ("You are no longer AFK" and "You are now DND: Do Not Disturb") but you'll only see a single PLAYER_FLAGS_CHANGED event.

name: PLAYER_LEAVE_COMBAT
description: Fired when the players opponents die or he dies

name: PLAYER_LEAVING_WORLD
description: Fired when a player logs out and possibly at other situations as well

name: PLAYER_LEVEL_UP
description: Fired when a player levels up.

args.description: New player level. *Note that [UnitLevel("player")](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_UnitLevel) will most likely return an incorrect value when called in this event handler or shortly after, so use this value.*
Talent points gained from leveling. Should always be 1 unless the player is between levels 1 to 9.
Attribute score increases from leveling. Strength (5) / Agility (6) / Stamina (7) / Intellect (8) / Spirit (9).

name: PLAYER_LOGIN
description: Triggered immediately before PLAYER_ENTERING_WORLD on login and UI Reload, but NOT when entering/leaving instances.

name: PLAYER_LOGOUT
description: Sent when the player logs out or the UI is reloaded, after PLAYER_LEAVING_WORLD, but before variables are saved.

name: PLAYER_MONEY
description: Fired whenever the player gains or looses money.

name: PLAYER_PET_CHANGED
description: Fired when a player's pet changes.

name: PLAYER_PVP_KILLS_CHANGED
description: Fired when you slay another player

name: PLAYER_QUITING
description: Fired when the player hits the quit button.

name: PLAYER_REGEN_DISABLED
description: Fired whenever you get aggro, as normal regen rates are disabled during combat.

name: PLAYER_REGEN_ENABLED
description: Fired a few seconds after ending combat, as regen rates return to normal.

args.description: holds the same value as GetTime() yields.

name: PLAYER_TRADE_MONEY
description: Fired when the player trades money

name: PLAYER_UNGHOST
description: Fired when the player is alive after being a ghost.  Called after one of:  The player is alive when this event happens.  This is *not* called when the player is resurrected before releasing. PLAYER_ALIVE is triggered in that case.

name: PLAYER_UPDATE_RESTING
description: Fired when the player starts or stops resting, ei when entering/leaving inns/major towns.

name: PLAYER_XP_UPDATE
description: Fired when the player's XP is updated (due quest completion or killing)

name: PLAYTIME_CHANGED
description: Fired when the playtime state changes.

name: QUEST_ACCEPT_CONFIRM (TODO)
description: Fired when the player needs to confirm he wishes to accept a quest.

name: QUEST_COMPLETE
description: Fired when the player hits the "Continue" button in the quest-information page, before the "Complete Quest" button. As far as i can tell this is only ever called when you complete a quest, but just before you actually complete the quest(as stated above)

name: QUEST_DETAIL
description: Fired when the player is given a more detailed view of his quest.

name: QUEST_FINISHED
description: Fired whenever the quest frame changes (Detail to Progress to Reward, etc.) or is closed.

name: QUEST_GREETING
description: Fired when a quest is offered

name: QUEST_ITEM_UPDATE
description: Fired when the quest items are updated

name: QUEST_LOG_UPDATE
description: This event is fired very often.  This includes, but is not limited to: viewing a quest for the first time in a session in the Quest Log; (once for each quest?) every time the player changes zones across an instance boundry;  every time the player picks up a non-grey item;  every time the player performs a quest activity, such as killing a mob for a quest.

name: QUEST_PROGRESS
description: Fired when a player is viewing the status of their quest.

name: RAID_ROSTER_UPDATE
description: Fired whenever a raid is formed or disbanded, players are leaving or joining a raid (unsure if rejected join requests also fire the event), or when looting rules are changed (regardless of being in raid or party!)

name: REPLACE_ENCHANT
description: Fired when the player must confirm an enchantment replacement.

name: RESURRECT_REQUEST
description: Fired when another player resurrects you

name: SCREENSHOT_FAILED
description: Fired when a screenshot fails.

name: SCREENSHOT_SUCCEEDED
description: Fired when a screenshot is successfully taken.

name: SPELLCAST_CHANNEL_START
description: Fired when a spellcaster begins channelling  On version 1.2.1, this event doesnt seem to work.

name: SPELLCAST_CHANNEL_UPDATE
description: Fired when a channelling spell is updated.

name: SPELLCAST_DELAYED
description: Fired when a spellcast duration is increased

name: SPELLCAST_FAILED
description: Fired when a spell fails.

name: SPELLCAST_INTERRUPTED
description: Fired when a spellcast is interrupted

name: SPELLCAST_START
description: Fired when a spellcast is begun. This event seems to work if the spell has a casting time. For instant, there is no SPELLCAST_START but SPELLCAST_STOP.

args.description: Duration (arg2 seems to be in milliseconds ex. 1.5 second cast time shows as 1500

name: SPELLCAST_STOP
description: Fired when a spell cast stops. Called twice when the spell is channelled. Once at start, once at completion.

name: SPELLS_CHANGED
description: Fired when: 1. Learning new stuff that goes in the spellbook. 2. Opening the spellbook. 3. Changing/Equiping weapons. (Changes the Attack icon)

args.description: nil when the char learns stuff. Also when changing weapons and shapeshifting. In addition it seems to be called on regular intervals for no apparent reason.
# when the user opens the spellbook.
'LeftButton' when using the mouse to open the spellbook or to browse through the pages and tabs of the open spellbook.

name: SPELL_UPDATE_COOLDOWN
description: Fired when spell cooldown starts.

args.description: if the spell is triggered by keypress, returns the [GetTime()](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_GetTime) output in string format.  Otherwise, it will return "LeftButton" or "RightButton"

name: SPELL_UPDATE_USABLE
description: Fires when you enter combat or die.

name: START_LOOT_ROLL
description: Fired when a group loot item is being rolled on.

args.description: The rollID of the item being rolled on.

name: SYSMSG
description: Fired when a system message occurs.

name: TABARD_CANSAVE_CHANGED
description: Fired when it is possible to save a tabard.

name: TAXIMAP_CLOSED
description: Fired when the taxi frame is closed.

name: TAXIMAP_OPENED
description: Fired when the taxi viewer is opened

name: TIME_PLAYED_MSG
description: Fired when the client recieved a time played message.

name: TOOLTIP_ADD_MONEY
description: *Event was removed in version 1700. See [OnTooltipAddMoney](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_GameTooltip_OnTooltipAddMoney)* Fired when a tooltip has money added to it.

name: TOOLTIP_ANCHOR_DEFAULT
description: Fired when the tooltip anchor should be reset

name: TRADE_ACCEPT_UPDATE
description: Fired when the status of the player and target accept buttons has changed

args.description: Player has agreed to the trade (1) or not (0)
Target has agreed to the trade (1) or not (0)

name: TRADE_MONEY_CHANGED
description: Fired when the trade window's money value is changed.

name: TRADE_PLAYER_ITEM_CHANGED
description: Fired when the specified player itme will be changed by the trade.

name: TRADE_REPLACE_ENCHANT
description: Fired when the the player must confirm an enchantment replacement in the trade window.

name: TRADE_REQUEST
description: Fired when another player wishes to trade with you.

name: TRADE_REQUEST_CANCEL
description: Fired when a trade attempt is cancelled.

name: TRADE_SHOW
description: Fired when the Trade window appears after a trade request has been accepted or auto-accepted

name: TRADE_SKILL_CLOSE
description: Fired when a trade skill window is closed.

name: TRADE_SKILL_SHOW
description: Fired when a trade skill window is opened.

name: TRADE_SKILL_UPDATE
description: Fired immediately after TRADE_SKILL_SHOW, after something is created via tradeskill, or anytime the tradeskill window is updated (filtered, tree folded/unfolded, etc.)

name: TRADE_TARGET_ITEM_CHANGED
description: Fired when a specific item will be altered during the trade.

name: TRADE_UPDATE
description: Fired when the trade window is changed.

name: TRAINER_CLOSED
description: Fired when the trainer is closed.

name: TRAINER_UPDATE
description: Fired when the trainer window needs to update.

name: UI_ERROR_MESSAGE
description: Fired when the interface creates an error message. These are the red messages that show in the top middle of the screen. "Your inventory is full." is one example.

name: UI_INFO_MESSAGE
description: Fired when the interface generates a message. These are the yellow messages in the top middle of the window. "No fish are hooked." is one example.

name: UNIT_ATTACK
description: Fired when a units attack is affected.

name: UNIT_ATTACK_POWER
description: Fired when a unit's attack power changes.

name: UNIT_ATTACK_SPEED
description: Fired when your attack speed is being listed or affected

name: UNIT_AURA
description: Fired when an buff, debuff, status, or item bonus was gained by or faded from a player, NPC, or mob.  NOTE: This event is fired not only when a unit's buffs change, but when you change targets as well! -Myrrion

args.description: the [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) of the entity

name: UNIT_AURASTATE
description: Seems like the same as UNIT_AURA above (including arguments) but only for short buffs. As a Paladin, it was triggered each time I gained a 30 second buff (Paladin Seals), lost/canceled it, or switched targets from another player to myself. Needs more testing with other classes etc.

name: UNIT_COMBAT
description: Fired when an npc or player participates in combat

args.description: the [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) of the entity
Damage type in numeric value (0 - physical; 1 - holy; 2 - fire; 5 - shadow; 6 - arcane)

name: UNIT_DAMAGE
description: Fired when the units melee damage changes. Be warned that this often gets fired multiple times, for example when you change weapons.

name: UNIT_DEFENSE
description: Fired when a units defense is affected

name: UNIT_DISPLAYPOWER
description: Fired when the unit's mana stype is changed.

name: UNIT_DYNAMIC_FLAGS
description: Fired when the unit's flags are changed.

name: UNIT_ENERGY
description: Fired whenever a units energy is affected.  Seen unit names: * player

args.description: the name of the unit whose energy is affected

name: UNIT_FACTION
description: Fired when a target's faction is announced.

name: UNIT_FOCUS
description: Same as UNIT_MANA, except for certain classes. Hunter used to use focus, but now they use mana. But it is still used when a pets energy changes.

name: UNIT_HAPPINESS
description: *Not studied*

name: UNIT_HEALTH
description: Fired whenever a units health is affected. It is so important that it gets called twice when it's about the player (might do the same for other things too)  Seen unit names: * player, pet, target, mouseover, party1..4, partypet1..4

args.description: the name of the unit whose health is affected

name: UNIT_INVENTORY_CHANGED
description: Fired when the player equips or unequips an item. This is also be called if your target, [mouseover](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) or party member changes equipment (untested for hostile targets). This event is also raised when a new item is placed in the player's inventory, taking up a new slot. If the new item(s) are placed onto an existing stack or when two stacks already in the inventory are merged, the event is not raised. When an item is moved inside the inventory or to the bank, the event is not raised. The event *is* raised when an existing stack is split inside the player's inventory.

args.description: the [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) of the entity

name: UNIT_LEVEL
description: Fired whenever the level of a unit is submitted (e.g. when clicking a unit or someone joins the party)

args.description: the [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) of the entity whose level is submitted

name: UNIT_MANA
description: Fired whenever a unit's mana change either by usage or by regeneration. The event is also called when a unit is click on. Only gets called once, unlike its more important brother, UNIT_HEALTH.

args.description: the [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) of the entity

name: UNIT_MAXENERGY
description: Fired when a unit's maximum energy changes.

name: UNIT_MAXFOCUS
description: Fired when a unit's maximum focus changes.

name: UNIT_MAXHAPPINESS
description: *Not studied*

name: UNIT_MAXHEALTH
description: Fired when a unit's maximum health changes.

name: UNIT_MAXMANA
description: Fired when a unit's maximum mana changes.

name: UNIT_MAXRAGE
description: Fired when a unit's maximum rage changes.

name: UNIT_MODEL_CHANGED
description: Fired when the unit's 3d model changes.

name: UNIT_NAME_UPDATE
description: Fired when a unit's name changes.

args.description: the [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) of the entity whose name changed

name: UNIT_PET
description: Fired when a unit's pet changes.

args.description: The [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) of the entity whose pet changed

name: UNIT_PORTRAIT_UPDATE
description: Fired when a units portrait changes.

name: UNIT_PVP_UPDATE
description: Fired when the UI is loaded, and when player PVP status is changed or updated.

args.description: the unit whose pvp status has changed (ie. "player")

name: UNIT_RAGE
description: Fired whenever a units rage is affected.  Seen unit names: * player

args.description: the name of the unit whose rage is affected

name: UNIT_RANGEDDAMAGE
description: Fired when a unit's ranged damage changes.

name: UNIT_RANGED_ATTACK_POWER
description: Fired when a unit's ranged attack power changes.

name: UNIT_RESISTANCES
description: Fired when the units resistance changes

name: UNIT_SPELLMISS
description: Fired when a spell misses

args.description: Unit Name. arg1 can be 'target' 'mouseover' 'player' or 'partyX' possibly also 'raidX' in party and raid the 'X' represents the number

name: UNIT_STATS
description: Fired when a units stats are being passed to the player/thing

name: UPDATE_BATTLEFIELD_SCORE
description: Fired in Warsong Gulch whenever the flag status changes (picked up, dropped, etc).

name: UPDATE_BATTLEFIELD_STATUS
description: Fired whenever you join the queue, change the instance, enter the instance, or leave the instance. Which is nice.

name: UPDATE_BINDINGS
description: Fired when the keybindings are changed.  Fired after completion of [SaveBindings()](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_SaveBindings" title="API SaveBindings).

name: UPDATE_CHAT_COLOR
description: Fired when the chat colour needs to be updated.

name: UPDATE_CHAT_WINDOWS
description: Fired when there's a reason to update the chat windows.

name: UPDATE_MOUSEOVER_UNIT
description: Fired when the mouseover object needs to be updated. Fired when the target of the [UnitID](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_TYPE_UnitId" title="API TYPE UnitId) 'mouseover' has changed. No Arguments.

name: UPDATE_PENDING_MAIL
description: Fired when the player enters the world and enters/leaves an instance, if there is mail in the player's mailbox. Fired when new mail is received. Fired when mailbox window is closed if the number of mail items in the inbox changed (I.E. you deleted mail) Does not appear to trigger when auction outbid mail is received... may not in other cases as well

name: UPDATE_SHAPESHIFT_FORMS
description: Fired when the player changes his shape

name: UPDATE_WORLD_STATES
description: Fired within Battlefields when certain things occur such as a flag being captured.

name: VARIABLES_LOADED
description: Fired during the loading phase of the UI to indicate that the Saved Variables of all AddOns that will be loaded during the initial load (or reload) of the UI have have been read into memory from their files.

name: WHO_LIST_UPDATE
description: Fired when the client receives the result of a SendWho() request from the server. use [API SetWhoToUI](http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/API_SetWhoToUI) to manipulate this functionality.

name: WORLD_MAP_UPDATE
description: Fired when the world map should be updated.

name: ZONE_CHANGED
description: Fired when the player enters a new zone.  Zones are the smallest named subdivions of the game world and are contained within areas (also called regions). Whenever the text over the minimap changes, this event is fired.

name: ZONE_CHANGED_INDOORS
description: Fired when a player enters a new zone within a city.

name: ZONE_CHANGED_NEW_AREA
description: Fired when the user enters a new zone and a new area.  e.g. moving from Duskwood to Stranglethorn Vale.  In interface terms, this is anytime you get a new set of channels.  The ZONE_CHANGED events are mutually exclusive!

name: ZONE_UNDER_ATTACK
description: This doesn't seem to be sent for WorldDefense - it comes in on CHAT_MSG_CHANNEL and totally skips the ZONE_UNDER_ATTACK code in the client.  Is the same true for LocalDefense?
